Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: running the mm instance with `docker=1` parameter lets it get connected from a remote interface

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: so we could get it working similar to how masternodes work on other blockchains.

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: for example i have seen CROWN community has set up sites where you just pay for the server space and it gets automatically deployed with all you need

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: then from the wallet you connect to that server and complete the masternode setup from your local pc

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: that could be done with mm nodes too

Author: tolken#2655
Content: @siu - Chainmakers  respectfully, marketmaker liquidy isn‚Äôt the main issue.  I have bobs configured, most combinations of all had at least a couple trades go through over the past 6 months, for many of the most common pairs and see virtually no buy requests from alices, particularly lately.  Ordermatching, for whatever reason, isn‚Äôt reliable. Most Alice buyers try and give up. A handful of times I‚Äôve seen people here say  ‚Äúwts bch‚Äù or something, I let them know it‚Äôs in bdex, then they just go fill their orders in a cex.  I agree we need to have an easier to setup marketmaker, but I don‚Äôt think that has much of anything to do with the lack of activity on bdex.

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: there are definitively performance issues on current mm iteration.

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: but at the same time, the more orders available there are, the greater the possibility to diminish these issues

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: mm2.0 will solve most of the performance issues, but at the end, if there is no liquidity, there is not much that can be done.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Yeah, I am really excited to see that. I told Santa that‚Äôs all I want for christmas.

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: for example we are currently testing a new redesign of AtomicDEX

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: it will work similar to shapeshift and dICO app

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: but much more responsive than dICO app

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: user wont need to set price or utxo size, that will be handled in the background.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Excellent. Does it Just split to optimal UTXOs based on dICO specified parameters?

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Or something more complex than that?

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: it will autosplit on the first swap you try for a new address

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: some work is being done on detecting if the utxo size needed is available if it not, create it, but that will be integrated in mm2.0

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: right now its working on mm1.0 and its doing quite well.
